result.execSummary:
All charges against Johnnie E Reed II in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Johnnie E Reed II is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Correction made to bail set at Initial Appearance.  A $500 personal recognize bond was originally set.  hgj

Defendant Johnnie E Reed in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Case set for jury trial.  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to dismiss is granted by the Court without prejudice.  Cash bail on deposit shall be returned to the person who posted it.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Johnnie E Reed in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 9/21/15 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

ALL CONDITIONS TO REMAIN.

Attorney Joel Alan Mogren in court, defendant Johnnie E Reed not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $200.00.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with JANAE H.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Johnnie E Reed in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Johnnie E Reed in court.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Attorney Mogren as counsel for defendant at the rate of $60.00 per hour.  Attorney Mogren accepts appointment.  Order signed and filed.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 07/01/2015 until paid in full. Order signed and filed.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Case passed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Johnnie E Reed in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Johnnie E Reed in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge DALLET.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. 
Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES  NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Case is adjourned for pretrial in Branch 40.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
